Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: the best water pitcher and filters ever, have to much iron in my water and now thanx to you, my water is delicious. thanx Mrs.E  Ok, we have had time to try pitcher and filters out, cannot tell we have to much iron in our water. This will be our go to from now on. thank you Mrs.E ^___^  ok, we are into 11/25/23 and my water is amazing!! we are considering the bathroom sinks and the kitchen sinks.. so very impressed...  ^____^  Mrs.E

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Originally bought it for the price and good reviews. Super easy to use and really works great! Filer gets the bleach smell out of our city water and love that it and help reduce contaminants. Lid is easy to use as well. We use this daily and have so far gotten and new filter about monthly if not more.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: It does really good taste of water! No stomach reaction on a raw water anymore! Definitely will stop on this pitcher! Thanks a lot. Recommend!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: The water in the dorm I live in is kind of nasty. This makes it so I can use it, and still have good tasting coffee and food.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Love it ! I have cancer and needed to drink alkaline water got tired of buying bottles of water. So the wad a game changer

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
Researching water filter pitchers for home use is exhausting, they all make similar claims but few offer 3rd party lab results on what they can filter. My goal was to find a pitcher that can filter out the added fluoride in addition to heavy metals from old pipes, chlorine, and various other toxin chemicals. I live in Salt Lake City, and our city water is  very heavy and needs a decent filter system to be drinkable.
My research results can back with the Waterdrop only 2nd to the brand Clearly Filtered. The Clearly Filtered brand starts at $90 and the lab results between the two were close enough that the Waterdrop pitcher is the best option.
Pros:
-Filters fast, it takes less than a minute to filter a full reservoir.
-The water tastes great! The chlorine and metal taste is completely gone
-Does not filter important minerals for good hydration
Cons:
-The wood handle is unfinished, so it may need to be sanded at a later point from collecting dirt and grime. I recommend oiling the handle before using, but not a big deal

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I love this pitcher and the water is really good. The only problem is the top pops off if you tip it a bit too much. I just hold on to it as I pour.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I purchased this because I was exploring making kombucha and needed filtered water. I have not had any issues with making kombucha with the water from this pitcher and it ferments nicely. I also use it for my ice maker. Additionally, having cold water in the fridge is much better to drink than out of the tap. The water goes thru the filter fairly quickly, and the opening on the lid is perfect for filling it. Supposedly each filter does 200 gallons of water, which was another reason I was interested in this filter.
After a few months, the indicator light on the lid started blinking continually. I contacted the seller and within a few days I had a new lid. They replied to my email right away, so very good customer service.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I got exactly what I needed. Simple, easy & convenient. This is an absolute game changer. Affordable and healthy. I will Def be buying more of these for my friends and family.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I workout a lot so I'm drinking water a lot and buying the jugs for expensive. The fact that this is alkaline and a good ph is great. Easy to use, it fills up fast, it's a good size and holds a lot. The filter is good as well. The lid can be a little tricky if there's too much water, the weight pushes it up a bit, just gotta hold it down while you pour.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
Arrived undamaged and clean.
Tested the filtered water versus tap water and PH went from 6.5 to 8.5.
Keeping it!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Love this pitcher! The filters are easy to switch out and they last a long time. Water is always clean and taste fresh. It has a great atheistic look to it as well! Love the wooden handle and sleek design.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: We were buying bottles of waters for years & decided to purchase this water filter system & are we glad we did ! Wonderful to save money & efforts to have clean filtered water all the time !  Thankyou

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
The handle on this pitcher is oddly strong for such small contact point.
Iv had other alkaline pitchers and this ones filters the water quite fast! Has a convenient pour spout on top to load fresh water. Nice sleek design ... but that handle though!
Highly recommend!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
The media could not be loaded.
I can't believe what a great value this is. I purchased another water pitcher from a different brand a couple of months ago. It looks similar with the wood handle, but the other holds less and does very little to remove chlorine flavor. This one is not only larger, making it a better value, but the filter actually does take out all the chlorine.
Our city has terrible water and is really strong tasting. This removed every bit of the residual chlorine taste. It also filters quite fast for the amount of contaminants it is removing. The top has an opening so you can run water into it without taking off the lid. That is a nice feature for those of us that like simplicity. The indicater light is easy to set and reset.
The instruction manual that comes with it is quite clear, so follow instructions and soak the filter before hand and you won't have any issues at all.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Our water has a chemical smell and taste.  I‘ve happily stopped buying spring water in favor of filtering ours.  I’d strongly recommend the Waterdrop.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I absolutely love everything about it, I use for my family but I'm giving to my mom cause I bought another one for my family and I that's bigger it's the 35 cup water drop alkaline water pitcher ❤️

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: One customer posted a video of lid coming off when poring water- this is accurate. Once filter is installed correctly inside pitcher- the lid will come off when pouring. Must hold down. Nonetheless less- I value having cleaner water and love the look and design (w/exception to lid coming off).

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
Love the way it looks and the opportunity to choose a color. It matches my home and has a cute wood handle.
In terms of functionality it does the job well and the water tastes good. It’s easy to fill in with water and I love that the lid covers the whole top section of the filter so the dust doesn’t have a way to get in. Also the filter has an indicator that shows whether or not it’s time to change the filter. Very helpful.
Definitely a good buy.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I absolutely love this water filter so much! We used to have the Britta but later found that it doesn't really filter all that much except taste. So I did some research and found this and not only is it absolutely adorable but it filters what you want a water filter to filter! I also love that I can have it fill up and still be able to pour.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I dropped the pitcher on the floor and it cracked. Contact customer service and 2 days later received a replacement.
Recommend +++

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Got exactly what I was looking for. Sturdy handle and good reservoir. Clean look

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: A nice sleek design. If the filter works as good as the design 👍👍

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I have purchased this filter and have just received it. I was startled at how heavy the pitcher is when empty. I wouldn't recommend it for families with small kids or anyone who has weakness in their hands or shoulders.
I will write more when I've used it a bit more.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Water tastes great!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Love this! Water tastes great

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
The media could not be loaded.
Update:
From 3 stars to 5 stars now. I love it! It’s just the initial process i guess. They emailed me about it as well and was willing to replace but I realized it was unnecessary because it was clear after the soaking and flushing through a few times. The filtered out water came clear each time and now I’m on my new filter after a few months. It’s very convenient for two people and we saved on bottled waters. I think the price is reasonable and just right.
Original:
I just got it today and immediately followed all directions. I will update this rating later if it is just the initial installation of every new filter but yes, I have a couple black particles that are a little hard to see, and some teeny tiny white beads as well that reminds me of styrofoam. It’s a little hard to see in the photos and video but I was able to grab one to show yall. Is it normal and safe? The white stuff is so tiny that if I do not look carefully and if it actually gets through the filter to the supposedly clean filtered portion to drink, me or my family member might accidentally drink it and probably wouldn’t notice it. That would be concerning and scary to drink. I didn’t see any in the clean portion so far but I’m not sure that will be consistent throughout the refilling until it’s time for a new filter. It tastes fine and good. Looks attractive as well. I guess I’ll just keep checking each time i drink for now to see.

Title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
after finding out the truth about my PUR sink filter not cleaning my water nearly as well as i thought, i needed a change! got a great deal on a countertop Reverse Osmosis system on primeday. only issue with that (so far) is that it doesnt have an ALK (alkaline)/remineralize filter.
of course i found out about the health concerns of drinking pure RO/distilled water AFTER i made the purchase, which sent me on a frantic weeklong search for the best solution.
-mineral drops? nah. seems like pain to have to add them in constantly
-homemade solutions? nah. not as effective. pink himalayan salt does NOT have a substantial amount of most minerals (except sodium)
-a different RO system with an alkaline filter? nah. too expensive & I cant do undersink install
so i started looking at alkalizing/remineralizing filters/pitchers. not a purchase i planned to make, but life be's that way sometimes!
after comparing the lot of them, this was the best solution. i dont really care about the filtration... all im using it for is to put the stripped minerals back & raise the pH. it worked. my TDS rose by about 20-25 after using this filter, showing that it did indeed add minerals back.
the unit is priced well & the filters are not exorbitant... amazon has a bundle w/ the pitcher (1 filter incl) & a 3pk of replacement filters for less than $60. that will last me (more than) a year.
also impressive design & slim to fit in fridge. i like. fingers crossed!
*************
* UPDATE *
*************
#1 i still LOVE the pitcher itself (excellent smart design & weigh distribution on the hands for a full 1/2 gallon of water!
BUT... looked deeper into the whole remineralizing deal (there is a very large dedicated user(fan)base out there! wow!) to see if my results from this pitcher/filter were really bringing my RO water up to healthy & beneficial standards. IT'S NOT!
while this filter does add SOME solids... whatever they may be (upon asking the company, they cant confirm to me what or at what levels/%'s theyre adding to my water. thats just not good enough for me as that info is important for optimal health.
my h2o is going from 176ppm (tap) to 6 (RO filter) to 26 (after a run thru the chubby alk). i WAS impressed. BUT, after chatting/reading others, the overall consensus was that 20ish ppm bump was virtually useless. barely anything being added back to my stripped water (came to find out that remineralizing/alkaline pitchers are considered a bit of a 'joke' in the industry). they simply dont do enough. so its just not worth it for my sitch since THAT is literally the only reason i bought the rig.
so... just bought trace mineral drops. i add 20 of em to my 1/2gal mason jars of RO h2o. not such a pain afterall! TDS is up to 220-250ppm!! even higher TDS than my untreated tap water! but this is all GOOD trace minerals. & I 100% trust the mineral content (i requested a test results chart showing everything found) & the source/company. all works out to a little less than $10/month. for REAL results? i can do that. as far as Waterdrop's laughable increase of 20ppm? oh I cant go for that... no can do.
so i changed my rating from 5 to 2 stars (woulda been 1 but they get credit for the beautiful pitcher design & the fact that it might be more beneficial for people who will settle for 'PUR' type filtration).
sorry chubbs. ill miss ya but i cant use ya! youre going back.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is perfect for quick filling and great tasting water. I haven't done any testing of the quality but the build of the pitcher is solid. The lid makes it easy to fill. My daughter (9 years old) loves using it, can pour it easily on her own and has been drinking more water because of it. Filters are easy to install. I love this pitcher and would buy another one.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
The company reach out and offered a replacement eventhough it was out of the return period. I highly recommend. They have the best customer service. If you wanna read the complete story is below.
I purchased two water filter pitchers from your company, and unfortunately, one of them broke within just four months of use. While the first pitcher seemed fine initially, the handle of the second one snapped off when I tried to lift it with water inside. This experience has left me disappointed and questioning the overall quality of the product.
As a loyal customer, my experience with waterdrop's water filter pitcher has been a mixed bag. While one pitcher has met expectations, the other's untimely breakage has left me disappointed and concerned about the overall product quality. I sincerely hope they will take prompt action to rectify this situation and stand behind the durability of their products in the future.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: It's the easiest-to-fill filter pitcher I've ever used. Water tastes like it's from a spring in Narnia. And it's not ugly, which is a bonus. Health benefits? I have no clue, but why not try for this price & simplicity? The worst that can happen is you're drinking water. 10/10 recommend.

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I YouTube researched this filter and found that it filtered out more than the Brita. The exception being fluoride. They claim to remove it, but these "independent testers" have found that the Waterdrop removes approximately 0 fluoride. Those levels are low in my area and I'm not sure where I'm at on the fluoride debate anyway. That is the only thing holding me back from a 5-star review! I love how it looks, the way it functions, and more. It filters water fast and holds more than my previous pitcher.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Great water pitcher, very easy to use and the wood handle adds a nice touch as well. I've never used one of these before. I purchased it because I wanted to rid the city water in my home of fluoride and other harmful chemicals. I can't say that I've really noticed a difference in the taste but hopefully it's working. I wanted to write this review because I saw a lot of negative reviews about the red light coming on and staying on within a few days or way less than 90 days. The red light in my pitcher started flashing exactly 50 days from the time I activated it. I called the customer service number in the back of the owner's manual just to see if they could offer any explanations since it's supposed to last for 90 days. The lady I spoke with was very nice and informative. She said that anytime the red light starts flashing before the 90 days is up that it's definitely a malfunction but that the FILTER is fine and that it will continue to properly filter for the full 90 days. Unfortunately, I had already taken the filter out and replaced it with a new one. She said that the filter I removed would dry up quickly and wouldn't be any good so there wasn't any way to get the remaining 40 days out of it. Even if I had immediately put it back into the pitcher, the new filter would have dried out so either way I was out of a filter. She said she would send a new pitcher lid and water filter (to replace the one I had damaged by removing) which I received within a few days. Also, I want to add that if your red light starts blinking and it won't turn off, just hold it in for about 3 seconds and it should reset. If and when the water starts to filter slowly, all you have to do is take the filter out and shake it firmly against your hand about 10 times and it will start to filter more quickly. I've done that a few times and it makes a huge difference. If you have any problems with the pitcher or filters, I HIGHLY recommend giving them a call to see if they can help you out in any way.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I
first purchased one of these pitchers and the top had a tendency to fall off, the company immediately sent me a brand new one to replace the one I purchased. The pitcher itself is super cute and functions pretty well but this is without a doubt the best customer service I have ever received!! They followed right back up with me to see if this one was better, it is definitely better but still a little loose on the lid but nothing that's that much of an inconvenience. They offered to send me free filters for the trouble (of which there really was none). Blown away by this customer service, they'll have my business as long as they're in business!!

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I love my pitcher! The only downside is the top isn’t secure. Make sure your hand is on top or you will have a major mess to clean. The water taste great!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Nothing

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
Bought this pitcher as a gift for the family next door.  In Texas our water is severely polluted from decades of pollution & contamination from oil companies.  It's not safe for you or your animals to drink Tap water.  Ask your vet if you don't believe us.
The 200 gallon filters are one of it's biggest selling points. Both Brita and PUR require very frequent changes. Note we drink water 90% of the time.  This product is much more cost efficient.
We like the way the filter runs the whole width of the water jug; not just a corner. If you remove the lid to add water, put faucet in middle. This way each side of filter works.
If you are in a hurry ( and who isn't these days?). You can use a recyclable straw to prop the little window on the top. Then pour water to purify with a measuring cup or something with a spout.
Water tasted the cleanest, purest in a glass
Metal cups can add a tiny taste and plastics retain odors.  Took us a little to get used to taste. It's different. I would say pUR filtered water tastes better.  Put when faucet was replaced, PUR no longer fit.  The Water drop pitcher wins 4/5 categories.
The wood handle is very strong and easy to grasp. Pitcher does get heavy when full. Do not add water past the filter.  Happy Drinking

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: My filter replacement light went on a few days ago. 2 months just like they said it would. I tested the water and the filter is still doing what it is supposed to. I hardly used 30 gallons in 2 months. So before you buy replacement filters before their time, check your water.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
1st I looooveee the water taste. I can barely drink bottled water now. I'm telling you....it's so pure that it's yummy. 2nd I had a problem with my filter change light reminder after almost a year. This company was easy to contact AND they sent me a replacement with no problems. In this world of 20 minute customer service wait lines and less than stellar support of their own products, this company is a stand out.
Believe me.....you need to give this system a try. You won't be disappointed!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Muy buen filtro, buen sabor del agua filtrada.

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Would've done five stars but the lid is easy to come off when pouring. Other than that no complaints, easy to clean ,easy to store, easy to fill and fast to drain. Fresh tasting water that is our new pick for drinking water.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I bought the alkaline filter set, LOVE IT! I ordered the pitcher with the regular filters by mistake, I wanted the alkaline set. I called the company directly and they were very kind & professional. They mailed me the filters that I meant to buy, on the house and they were in my hands within days. WOW, so very happy to spend my money with them! It all works great & looks great!

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
Had this beauty for almost 2 years and it does come with a bizarre problem.
When I use the filter, algae grows like crazy. I can now taste it and it appears a day later. Tried every test I could: put in shady, cool location, soak filter for 24 hours, fridge. Every time the filter inserted in the pitcher: algae.
And it spreads. In the Nespresso machine, the pet dishes.
So why only 1 star off? Still, looks so cool on the countertop.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I took this pitcher along with me to a place we stayed at near Pigeon Forge, TN and I am so glad I did.  The water at the place we stayed at had a foul smell and probably was from some sulfur or something.  This filter completely removed the odor and tasted just like it does when I use it at home.  The water goes though fairly quick so it doesn't take long to "process" it and get good, clean water that is alkalized, mind you.  A very sustainable product that saves from buying bottled water that I know is not good for the earth.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: The blue light won't stop blinking and the team sent out a replacement lid very quickly!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
The water system my mother is on seems to have the chlorine level cranked up for some reason, so much so we had to fit filters to her showers so that it wouldn't irritate her skin. She had been buying bottled water for a long time, but I wanted to see if a filtered picture would address the problem. I can report this does solve that problem.
I wanted something that would be easy for her to use, and not require frequent filter changes. This definitely fits the bill. I was impressed enough with it that I decided to purchase one myself, despite already having one of another brand. I've since had to purchase a ZeroWater pitcher for use with my humidifier (because I needed a product to filter dissolved solids), but when using it I sorely miss the design of the Waterdrop Chubby.
Simply being able to place it under the faucet and fill through the flap, rather than pulling off and replacing a lid is how every pitcher should work in my opinion. The Chubby also comes with a little device that apparently counts the number of openings, and uses that to flash an alert when it is time to change the filter. As such, it should be much more accurate than simply changing a filter based on time alone.
The filter in the Chubby is essentially a dual filter, with two small streams emitted into the reservoir. As such, it fills much faster than other pitchers that emit only a single small stream.
It also pours quickly and easily, something that definitely wasn't the case with my first filter picture.  My ZeroWater pitcher also does well on that front, but is still bested by the Chubby.
The wood handle seems sturdy and feels good in the hand. I like the no-nonsense straight side design, as opposed to the tapered bottom one will find on many other pictures. A strictly rectangular design might be more efficient in terms of water volume for the footprint occupied, but that would also be more difficult to clean.
The only possible fault I've seen is one that seems to be shared with all pitchers (and certainly the three I've had experience with): The cover for the spout. All of them seem to be the same "I'm going to break some day" design. The plastic of the spout cover on the Chubby's seems to be a bit softer, so I doubt it will literally break, but it already has loosened enough on one side that it usually tilts to one side when open. I don't consider that a big issue, as it still stays out of the way of the stream, and goes back into place when pushed down.

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I refuse to buy bottled water, and drank tap water.
The more I read, the more concerned I became. I did a little research, along with reading  reviews.
I settled on this on, and glad I did. Filters last a long time, and replacements are priced reasonably.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Easy to fill water filters fast.  Taste just like store bought bottled water. Filter lasts longer than expected. Easy to clean.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I switched over from using the Pur water pitchers and filters because I was annoyed by how frequently I had to replace the filters, and the poor design of the water pitcher. I appreciate the longer lasting Waterdrop filters—my household uses a lot of filtered water for cooking, drinking, making tea, and for my Sodastream (we make many bottles weekly of soda and sparkling water with teenage boys in the house!). I keep a dispenser on the counter and a pitcher in my refrigerator, and the filters usually last me two months because of the quantity of water we use. Tap water where I live is chlorinated (you can taste it!), and the Waterdrop filters make our water taste great. The top of the pitcher is secure, unlike my previous Pur pitcher that fell off and cracked when I poured water. The Waterdrop Pitcher a little bit wider than I expected, and the wood handle looks great, but also makes the pitcher a bit heavier than the Pur. Overall though, in my opinion, the water tastes better, the filters last longer, and the lid design is better than the Pur, so I am happy with my purchase.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have been using this picture for about a year now. I really like it. Water filters quickly and it taste good

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Really Happy with the Value of this Purchase -simple to use and offers lots of Value for Price Point

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This thing is easy to set up. The water is as good as water can be! Where I live the water really isn’t that bad but this does take the chlorine taste out of it.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I feel like it has to be said that I have ADHD and things like having to keep refilling the filtered water are really hard for me to maintain. I've used a Brita and a Pür, and both take so long to fill up, because you have to wait for the first pour to filter - which barely fills the bottom basin - and then do another pour, if you have the patience for it. It's also a pain to remember when you need to change the filter.
This pitcher fills up without having to take off the lid, and filters through to the bottom basin in under a minute, so I'm able to fill the whole thing up super quickly. And there's a convenient light that tells you when the filter needs to be changed.
I will be quite hydrated from now on!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is used for drinking and watering my plants . It does great .

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I want to give a shout out to Carlotta from Waterdrop customer service! Amazing & efficient help, above & beyond expectations.
I had an issue with the filter timer, not any more, thank you 👍
This pitcher & the filters create wonderful, crisp, fresh tasting water! You can feel confident the junk is out of your tapwater by using this. Even coffee & tea tastes better!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: After trying multiply alkaline based filters I love this one. I don’t have to remove the lid to add water, it lets you know when to change it, but also it’s so much bigger than any other hand held. After days of searching I’m glad I settled with this one, just wish it came with an extra filter.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I never heard of this brand before. But after about 30 minutes on Google and YouTube I thought I would give it a try since it came so highly rated. I couldn't believe it! My tap water tastes like pool water. Very laden with fluoride and other softeners. Seriously, who wants to drink pool water? I ordered the "Chubby" model, followed all the instructions, ran my first batch and the water had absolutely zero taste. It was just H2O. Even tasted better when I put the pitcher in the fridge overnight. Forget Zero Water and Pur. Wasted money. Invest in WaterDrop! Yes, I'm a real customer!

Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: It filters well - long life on the filter with hard water...its just there comes a point when the lip cracks - nothing im doing. I hand wash really only when I change the filter...but it creates a big mess and water goes in my cup and all over the floor. The first one I bought 4 years ago the second about 16 months ago...idk I like the filter capacity but I'm getting annoyed with how often I have to buy....

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I had a problem with a refill filter that was very slow, called the Co. and they sent me a replacement PRONTO!! Love this product, I fill all my 7 pets bowls with filtered water 2X a day per my Vet. I drink it too!
I also have Waterdrop filters in my GE fridge, instead of paying twice as much for the GE replacements!

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Flavor with two is five stars. Flavor with one is three stars.  I double filter by using two of these because the water tastes better that way and also in order to take more of the contaminants out that one will not do sufficiently. Having said that, by using a system of two of these pitchers, it seems to be working quite nicely. If you use this system and your water has a strong component of chlorine, I recommend using two of them. I know it's costly, but poor health is even more costly, so there is that...

Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Have had the Waterdrop for a little over a month and the light you set on the top to let you know to change the filter is blinking for over a week now. I have run the filter under water and reset the button on top but comes right back on. It's been a little over 30 days so I can't return it. The size is somewhat awkward and takes up a lot of space in the refrigerator. I have to say I wanted to like it but am disappointed and know the filter should not have to be changed this soon.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: We started to get some little black specks in our water and still trying to find out where it is coming from, so in the meantime we bought this water drop pitcher and this seems to do the job of providing us clean water.  Even thinking about getting an under-sink water purifying system, so this might just be the brand we get.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is a amazing water pitcher. It's runs fast and water tastes so good. I have tried other brands but this one is the best 🙂

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Really like the design of this pitcher.  I've had other brands in the past, and I like this one best.  Pleased with my purchase.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is a replacement for one I knocked off my counter.  I'm happy with the new pitcher.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I recently purchased this water filter pitcher and I have to say that I'm really impressed with it. One thing that really stands out about this pitcher is how aesthetically pleasing it is. I love the wood handle, which adds a touch of elegance to our kitchen counter. More importantly, the pitcher does a great job of filtering our tap water, which previously had a strong chlorine taste. Now our water tastes great and is much more enjoyable to drink. The pitcher is also durable and easy to use, which is always a plus. Overall, I highly recommend this water filter pitcher to anyone looking for a product that not only looks great on their kitchen counter, but also provides great-tasting filtered water.

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I like that it's as pretty as the Soma but doesn't dribble water everywhere like the Soma.  The wood handle is lovely and easy to hold, but unfinished so will maybe get grimey and I'll have to sand it and/or oil it.  The top hatch that opens with pressure from the water is great so you don't have to remove a lid or anything -- they should all have this - but I wish it were a bit more sensitive so that I didn't get any pooling of water on top of the lid.  The water tastes great and I really like how quickly it filters, much faster than my previous Brita.  I'm small so I can't lift the full pitcher with one hand so I wish this pretty design came in a smaller size but it's really great.  Looks great on my counter.
Update: it does dribble a bit when it's all the way full, and the lid wants to fall off when you're pouring the last drop when it's empty.  The water flap takes a second to open when you run the faucet into it which is just enough time for water to spill all over the lid.  Also, it's just big enough that little old me can't lift it when full with one arm.  Easy solutions: I never fill it all the way full, I always use two hands, hold the lid on when pouring the last bit and wipe it down with a kitchen cloth to dry it off every time I fill it.  If they made one that is just as pretty but a little bit smaller, with a water flap that's a little more sensitive and a lid that stays in place even at the last-drop angle, I would happily buy it.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I ordered this pitcher after having had experience with the company when previously ordering replacement filters for a Zero Water pitcher.  I had a few questions because I had never had a pitcher specifically designed to filter alkaline water.  Their customer service rep answered all my questions and said to contact the company if I had any problems.  After using the pitcher for about a week, I realized that I didn't really like the taste of alkaline water.  I emailed the company and asked if I could order the non alkaline replacement filters for this pitcher.  Emily got right back to me and told me they would send me a free replacement filter since I didn't like the alkaline one.  Wonderful customer service...not easy to find these days.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I really enjoy that it so easy to fill and has an auto stop opening in the lid. The water is delicious and great to start the day with. I am really glad I made this purchase.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I've been looking for a pitcher that looks nice and not too expensive to to replace the filter. This is great. It looks good, not too big and works great. Its a little weird when you pour the water out but there's a certain way you have to hold the pitcher and it makes it easy.
The water filters pretty quick. The only thing I don't care for is when you fill it up with water, the water splashes a little because it hits a trap door looking thig first then it starts to go in. Its cool and all but it gets water all over the top of the pitcher. The cool thing about the trap door is it closes on its own when the reservoir is getting full to let you know to stop filling it up. Over all this is the best one i've found for a good price. I plan on getting one more for my fridge at work. the filters are also good for like 3 months which makes it nice

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
This the first pitcher I bought with a different cover!  I had purchased 3 other pitchers from three other companies. However, they all seemed to use the same covers with the barely seen(as it was too light) notification on when to change filter and the tops don’t  fit tightly and fall off!!!! This one, however, has a totally different cover with a little LED type of light (small circle on top toward the back) that will light up when filter needs changing after the initial set up. The wooden handle feels more sturdy. There is a hole with a clear cover on the top. When you turn on the water to fill, it opens  with the force of the water and closes immediately when you remove the pitcher from the fill. Genius!  You can remove the top, obviously, when you want to change the filter or clean. With the other companies, I concur with the other complaints, that it was impossible to get feedback from the companies.
Follow up review:  I have been using this Alkaline Pitcher for over a year.  I had a problem taking the housing out to clean the bottom. Emailed the company and they returned the email within 24 hours!  I couldn't accomplish what they suggested, as my housing holding the filter would not come out to clean. The result?
They sent me a brand new pitcher!  How is that for excellent customer service!  Very rare these days!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Dropped my old one and replaced it with this

Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Works great, filters pretty standard time. Just wish I’d checked on the price of replacement filters - they are the same (or more) than purchasing a whole new until. I cut my loss and ordered a different brand that 4 filters are less expensive than this 1.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I like this better than Britta, but the cartridges don't last as long. Water filtered w this, does seem to behave the same way as distilled water does in the freezer (frozen distilled water behaves differently than tap water) - which makes me think it really does filter the water. Britta filtered water does not behave the same. I am NO expert though, just noting a finding. This filter also removes the smell of bleach my tap water has.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I love this alkaline water pitcher! So easy to use and to replace the filters. It consistently gives between an 8 and 9 ph, leaning lots closer to the 9. Helps with my LPR.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Definitely gets rid of that awful tap water taste

Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I followed all the steps to install the filter into this pitcher and it continues to have a fishy smell and taste.  I use purified water (not tap water) in this pitcher.  I have relegated use of this pitcher for alkaline water for cooking and protein shakes.  Lid and filter insert have a tendency to come loose/ fall off during pour.

ProfileName: Thankyou soo much..Iam very happy and satisfied with my dresses.This was my first experience with Delisa Fashion and they didnot disappoint me at all.I must say the qualitu of dresses is excellent..  The Dress is exactly as shown in the picture..I recommend you guys to shop from Delisa Fashion cause they have amazing dresses...
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I was really worried about the bottle water we drink at home cause it was not safe at all especially due to plastic bottles..Now My all tention has gone due to waterdrop filter..It is an amazing product.Thankyou

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
Our tap water has a metallic taste to it, so I was buying bottled water. When I weighed the cost of all the bottles, plus the harm to the environment of all that disposable plastic, a water filter made sense.
I picked this one because it filters out all of the things that concerned me, and bonus---it's really pretty!
Super easy to refill, easy to change the filter, easy to clean, easy to pour, and we love the clean taste.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Replaced our older water filter pitcher with this one and wish I would have done it sooner! The water filters so much faster and tastes better. It also filters more gallons than our older one. Went ahead and ordered one for our daughter for college to replace hers as well. It is a noticeable improvement in taste!  And bonus,  they are just better looking ! Get you one or 2!

Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I've used the new filter and a replacement filter (about 5-6months).  After about 2monthes of use the first time, I was shocked to see green build-up on the bottom of my pitcher.  I cleaned it thoroughly - again - and it has repeated that green build-up again with the second, new filter.  I'm getting rid of this pitcher!
I've had a Mavea pitcher for 4-5 years and have never had a problem, like this, with the Mavea pitcher.  Luckily I kept my Mavea and will continue to use even tho the digital display doesn't work.

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I really wanted a glass version of this filter. Pours well, long life to filter, good design

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: We like this pitcher because it is so easy to fill with an opening on the lid, rather than having to take the whole cover off to refill. Also, it fills quickly, which is a plus when filling three pet fountains constantly. The handle is a little awkward, but overall, it's nice looking. Would definitely recommen this product.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Absolutely a game changer fur me I’ve spent hundreds of dollars not drinking out of the faucet so the water tastes good and it was easy to put together and it looks clean and sleek definitely will recommend

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I've used a Brita filter pitcher for a year or two, and only bought this one because it was a really good deal on Amazon and we needed a second unit. I cansay without exaggeration that it is the best designed product I've bought in a long time. Why? (1) it filters at least twice as fast as the Brita, with two water streams instead of one, (2) the real wood handle makes it easier to hold and looks great, (3) the cover design includes a neat oval flap so you don't have to remove the cover to fill the pitcher, put it under the tap and the water pressure pushes it open, (4) filters are promised to last 3 months, and are less expensive than Brita.
I highly recommend this product!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: i have tried multiple water filters but this one is amazing. a bit pricey for sure but when it comes to your health, no need to compromise. you can taste pure water. i have also seen comparison videos on YouTube who deemed this one to be the best of all.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I really didn't think I was going to like this but I decided to try it anyway it really works well we have the worst public water. But this makes the water taste nice. I have not drinken tap water for over 13 years. until now.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I would like to buy another one...it's worth the price.

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Everything came in nicely! I was worried about the filter having the black mineral all over it but I called Water Drop Company and the representative said that it is good to use and it's normal just need to follow the instructions and rinse it off and soak it before use!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I got this to replace the other alkaline pitcher I got last month… I came packaged nicely all sealed up. I fallowed the directions and stuck in in the frig for a few hours. Then I used my SodaStream, I love bubble water, with my nice cold alkaline water. It was perfect, no floaties or bad taste, just water. So Stoked.
It’s my first day, so if anything comes up I’ll revise my note.  Get it !!!
I did put grape seed oil on the wood handle so it holds up in the fridge and it makes it look better…

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Aesthetically pleasing, double filtration system, smart refill design and most importantly, the lid does not fall off when you pour water out while there is still water to be filtered! Water tastes great. I have this for over a year now. Just remembered to change filter, cannot give higher compliments than this. Threw my old water pitcher away already. Get this. So highly recommend.

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Made better than the britta container. No leaks on handle seams, or unfiltered water mixing with filtered while pouring a glass. Filtered water never connects with unfiltered, completely kept separate. Nicer container and filter storage. Filters more chemicals out of the tap water than britta does. Also filter drips clean water faster and last 1 month longer than the standard britta filter.  My only draw back to this container is,  they should rethink the container cap. When it's near empty, the cap falls off if tilted to high. You have to hold it in place to drain the pitcher. Otherwise I'd still buy again.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I rarely write reviews.  Quite frankly, it's work. But these people, and this product, are absolutely the BEST I've ever come across.  Quick run down... The water filtration system is unparalleled.  I've had many systems.. Brita, Clear-Q, Aqua1, etc...  This thing literary pulls every microbe and piece of sludge from your tap. When you change the filter, you can literally feel the weight of all the heavy metals and PCB's it removes.  The water it filters tastes like it's from a mountain stream, and it's texture is like silk.  And when my LED sensor (filter timer) went dead after more than a year of heavy use, and WaterDrop was out of stock on that specific replacement part... they replaced the whole pitcher for free!!!  Didn't even pay for shipping.  I absolutely love this product, and their service.  I'm telling you right now... buy it.  Be healthy.  Be happy.  The water you drink should be as clean as the air that you breathe. Trust me.  "DROP" everything you're doing, and taste the good life!!!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I used to refill water jugs at a dispenser for cheap but they were either out of water or the filters were not replaced more often than I would've liked. Buying WaterDrop pitcher was the best decision I've made in this trying time of COVID-19.
Initially, I had a little trouble because I saw no way to separate the inner *shelf* which suspends the filter from the outer pitcher. I just wanted to clean it before use. The customer service was very polite and helpful in responding to my dumb question. There are 4 small notches at the top that secure the filter holder to the pitcher but the plastic is so clear that I didn't see them, lol!  All I had to do was to slightly *pinch* the inner one to release.
The pitcher works very well, so quick, so easy and efficient. I experience no difficulty in refilling or pouring the last drop. The digital counter even works fine. I wish it were bigger like a gallon size but I guess many people keep it in the fridge, so good size for that. I like the extremely clear plastic material it's made of, the fact the filter doesn't sit in water, and more importantly it prevents/reduces limescale for my coffee maker. And I don't have to rely on the water dispensers that aren't maintained properly or regularly by somebody else other than me. Best of all, I don't have to go out for refills. The only caveat is that the replacement filters are currently unavailable on Amazon(and the price of the filters has gone up but so did many many other things due to the pandemic). If it really lasts 90 days or 200 gallons, it'd be 4 times cheaper than refilling at the dispensers, so I'd be content with even 50 gallons per filter.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I absolutely LOVE this water pitcher!  Our old water pitcher was slower, the lid was always falling off if we tilted it too much and if you filled it, but all of the water had not filtered through yet - it would come out the top when you tilted the pitcher too far.  This one does not do any of those things.  It filters fairly fast and water tastes great.  We also love the way you fill this pitcher, by not removing the lid, but by simply aiming the water at the fill hole/flap on the top.  If you just filled it with fresh water, but it had not all filtered through to the bottom yet - you still have no issues in going ahead and pouring the filtered water and using it, without having the unfiltered water you just put in spill out or pop off the lid.

Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Smart Light Indicator for Water drop Alkaline Pitcher last 2 months only- no good. need a replacement. why is the manufacture not selling them separtely if thye know that thye can not last more than 2 months?

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: FINALLY! A water pitcher with a design that is practical and makes sense! FINALLY a pitcher that has a lid that does not fall off easily when I pour! FINALLY a handle that feels sturdy and doesn't feel like it can barely handle the weight when full. I LOVE the design. I also appreciate that the filter doesn't have to sit in the water (something that I have never understood). The solid wooden handle makes it look pricier. I have no idea if this thing only looks good. But hey I had no proof that the others did as advertised either. This one filters a lot faster. I don't know it that is a plus or a minus. I just got it and haven't drunk a drop yet! But I already like it much better than the ones that I have paid a lot more for. I sure hope that it lives up to the others and lives up to the design.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: The taste is pretty good, not quite the same as bottled but a heck of a lot cheaper

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have hard well water and these make my water taste great! The container is attractive and I love the feel of the wood handle. I have purchased several of these, as well as a Waterdrop filter system for my kitchen sink. I'm very pleased with the brand.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Making drinking water for ice tea and ice cubes in our RV.
